tests.name: Command Definition Test
tests.input: command | name=MyCustomCommand | arg0 name = a0 | arg1 name = a1 | arg2 name = a3

tests.name: hello world
tests.input:
test | say hello
echo | hello, world
# Comments should be ignored
tests.expect:
Start Test say hello
    Command | command=echo | target=hello, world | value=
End Test say hello

tests.name: Login Button specified by ID
tests.input: control | name = Login Button 1 | Id=btnLogin | FriendlyName = Login Btn
tests.expect: Define control | name=Login Button 1 | strategy=id | selector=btnLogin | friendlyName=Login Btn

tests.name: # Login button specified by CSS
tests.input: control | name = Login Button 2 | css=#btnLogin | FriendlyName = Login Btn
tests.expect: Define control | name=Login Button 2 | strategy=css | selector=#btnLogin | friendlyName=Login Btn

tests.name: Login button specified by XPath
tests.input: control | name = Login Button 3 | xpath=//@id=btnLogin | FriendlyName = Login Btn
tests.expect: Define control | name=Login Button 3 | strategy=xpath | selector=//@id=btnLogin | friendlyName=Login Btn

tests.name: Login button with strategy and selector specified explicitly
tests.input: control | name = Login Button 4 | strategy=id | selector=btnLogin | FriendlyName = Login Btn
tests.expect: Define control | name=Login Button 4 | strategy=id | selector=btnLogin | friendlyName=Login Btn

tests.name: Login button with 1 indexer
tests.input: control | name = Login Button 5 | id=btnLogin${x} | FriendlyName = Login Btn
tests.expect: Define control | name=Login Button 5 | strategy=id | selector=btnLogin${x} | friendlyName=Login Btn | Param0=x

tests.name: Login button with 2 indexers
tests.input: control | name = Login Button 6 | id=btnLogin${x}${y} | FriendlyName = Login Btn
tests.expect: Define control | name=Login Button 6 | strategy=id | selector=btnLogin${x}${y} | friendlyName=Login Btn | Param0=x | Param1=y
